intro: Nautilocalyx aeneus, commonly known as the silver-leaf nautilocalyx, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Indonesia and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. Its leaves are usually elliptical and have a distinctive silvery underside, giving it its common name. Nautilocalyx aeneus is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and modest flowering display.
